result.execSummary:
The defendant Landon J Kozel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to time served on 6-7-16; unpaid court obligations of $32.67 and supervision fees of $120.00
Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to time served on 6-7-16; unpaid court obligations of $32.67 and supervision fees of !20
filed by attorney Winnig

Defendant Landon J Kozel in court with attorney Joel Winnig.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CM326 and 16CF85.  Amended complaint filed in 16CF85.  Reading waived.  In 16CF85 Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled guilty to amended complaint.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 1 year.  Conditions of probation include $443.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.   In 15CM326 Court sentenced defendant on Ct. 1 to serve 56 days in jail.  Ct. 2 30 days in jail, concurrent to Ct. 1.  42 days credit.  This is a time served sentence.  A civil judgment will be entered for all unpaid financial obligations in 15CM326.   10:31/11:00

11:37 A.M. Defendant Landon J Kozel in court, in custody with attorney Joel Winnig.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Winnig states there is an agreement for $1,000.00 cash bond, defendant to reside w/mother Theresa Valencia at W10209 Cty Rd K, Lodi, WI, abide by curfew of 10:00 P.M. to 6:00 A.M., start on treatment, Court approves agreement, 11:44 A.M.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.
For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Atty Cross
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by Atty Cross
